Reviews.Title: “Dirty, small, no amenities, wayyyyy overpriced!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: g g
Reviews.Content: Ok so I stayed at this hotel last week. I have stayed here in the past but very short trips and had probably the best room in the hotel when I stayed previously. The whole experience this time was terrible. To start out, they double billed us and booked 2 rooms instead of 1 as we requested. The room was small, smelly, sticky carpets, dirty bathroom, mildew/mold ceilings, and wait did I say small!! The linens were hideous, curtains were dirty, balcony neglected, the maintenance was shotty! Blah! The indoor pool is a joke, they closed the outdoor one which actually wasn't bad before. The elevator is rickety, the breakfast at the restaurant was terrible, the front desk staff were actually nice, but when we checked in there was only one person and it took awhile. Basically, don't waste your money and go here. It is so overpriced and needs a complete overhaul. DON'T WASTE YOUR MONEY!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: Chloebebe
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 2 nights. This hotel needs an update for sure. Can't really take a shower without worrying the water might leak out. Paid around $150 per night with free WiFi and Parking. Consider very good deal with so close to the boardwalk and shops.

Reviews.Title: “nice location but needs updating”
Reviews.Author: hbighamjr
Reviews.Content: beds were very hard, the location was perfect. we stayed in room 411 and the bathroom ceiling was leaking and also the phone was unhooked. the manager on duty was very nice and took care of our concerns. but when you are paying for 5 stars you shoud get five stars. the pool was very nice the bottom had some rough spots that hurt you feet.

Reviews.Title: “very welcoming”
Reviews.Author: ilovemusic
Reviews.Content: We stayed here a few times now and have to say that the staff is so helpful and friendly. If we had a need, it was taken care of immediately and our room was spotless. The balcony is very small, but it is oceanfront. The bathroom was my biggest problem. There is a pedestal sink and very little counter space. All in all, it's a convenient, nice place to stay with excellent staff. Thanks Mary Susan(manager)!!!!! Oops, forgot to mention that the restaurant had good breakfasts too

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: skoobaru
Reviews.Content: Great price for an Ocean-view (side balcony) room, right on the boardwalk! Located on 12th street, its right in the middle of the boardwalk. The room was clean, as was the bathroom, although the bathroom was small, it was big enough for my husband and I. And even though the shower head is "low flow", it was great!. The bed was super comfortable.There was a mix-up with my booking through Booking.com, but the girl at the front desk went out of her way to help fix it.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly Surprised”
Reviews.Author: Brooksey20
Reviews.Content: I must say that I have never stayed at a Howard Johnson, thinking it a bit rough around the edges; but waiting too long to book forced my hand and here I was....we pulled up and from start to finish, no real complaints. It's as overpriced as any other oceanfront boardwalk property in Ocean City; that being said I would stay again. Perfect location, pleasant staff, clean room. Super nice housekeeping staff. Coffee and restaurant on site, but literally all you want is right out the door. Lobby was inviting, kids got the lay of the land quickly and felt comfortable. You can park for your entire check out day in their facilities. We had a partial view of the ocean, but if you postion that balcony chair just right, you got a full view. Try it folks, you too will be pleasantly surprised.

Reviews.Title: “Presently surprised...”
Reviews.Author: marinewfie
Reviews.Content: We're having a great time here at the HOJO the location is perfect, is a bit far from the amusement park (it's on the other side) but a $3 tram ride will get you there. The front desk staff are a bit flaky though and the restaurant at the hotel is BAD don't do it! Overpriced food and bad you're better ordering a pizza instead! The room was clean, have a partial ocean view, good hotel for families. The lobby is nice when you walk in there is free garage parking behind the hotel. Definetley would consider staying again.

Reviews.Title: “Will defenitly be back”
Reviews.Author: kpkeyser
Reviews.Content: I was very pleased with our stay. We had a room with a georgeous view. 3 adults and 2 children and our room accomidated us nicely. The location was perfect for our 3 day plans. We walked to the restaurants and amusement park. People watched from our boardwalk balcony. Would have loved an outdoor pool, but the kids used the indoor pool. The oceanfront restaurant was great when we wanted a quick lunch. We ate outside in our bathing suits. The staff was friendly and our room was clean. I am already planning a trip back next year.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay in Ocean City.”
Reviews.Author: Gladys0512
Reviews.Content: We stay at this hotel every year when we visit Ocean City and every year we get top notch service. The hotel staff is friendly and more than happy to make our stay a great one. They go out of their way to make sure we have a great time. The hotel is very clean and the beds are comfortable. They are always updating the rooms. I would highly recommend this Howard Johnson's to anyone who visits Ocean Ciy.

Reviews.Title: “Great experience, 1st time in OCMD”
Reviews.Author: bean2526
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my husband in April, we had a great experience and would recommend this hotel to anyone who wants to be near the boardwalk. The room was clean, and the font desk staff was super friendly and helpful. I did read here that the elevator was a negative - honestly, it is just loud. We had a great time in OC, despite the rainy weather. We also took advantage of the Thrashers coupon deal that HoJo was offering - can't beat a free bucket of fries!

Reviews.Title: “Find another place to stay...”
Reviews.Author: GypsyOBRN
Reviews.Content: This was our forth year of staying at HoJo on our way to NC from NH. Why we keep going back & not trying the other hotels around the same area is beyond me. It's a great location, right on the boardwalk not far to walk to the activities but far enough away to not hear the activities when trying to rest. The staff are always pleasant, friendly & helpful. Now for the problem areas, where to begin. We always get a king room, one year ago the ceiling was leaking & smelled badly. They moved us the next day to another room. The beds are horrible, I think sleeping on a rock would be more comfortable. The pillows are just smaller rocks. The wifi doesn't work if you are at any distance from the ocean side of the hotel, connects & disconnects so much, I just got fed up & decided to wait till the next hotel to look at my email & such. We felt that they cater to the Spring golfers, they get the better facing rooms, the better beds & the staffs attention when needed. I think next year, I will heed my own advice & find another place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay ever in Ocean City”
Reviews.Author: millie g
Reviews.Content: The staff makes you feel like you are the only guest. It seemed like they did not know the word "NO". A few of the staff Janice, Brian, Mary Susan and Selma are just a few that made my stay terrific!! Thank you and I can't wait to come back!! You are my hotel of choice from here out!!

Reviews.Title: “great time away”
Reviews.Author: travels4you
Reviews.Content: I decided to treat myself to time away and rented a room here.The room i rented online was not the room that came accross on my reservation but they changed it without hesitation. the staff was wonderful and friendly. the pool was warm enough to swim in. view of the ocean was amazing and it was really nice to be right on the boardwalk. It was really nice to have a safe place to park my car while i was there as well. only complaints were the amount of food for the price and the elevator was slow.

Reviews.Title: “Bad customer service in unacceptable!”
Reviews.Author: Carrolnsteve
Reviews.Content: My fiance has to travel for work to OC for 5 days. He called the hotel directly over a month ago and wanted to get the rate for 7 nights...I decide to fly in during the week and we would stay the weekend. We were told they could give us the same rate for the whole week. Well we called last night to check the reservation as we had not received an email confirmation yet (but the credit card WAS billed already for one night!) and we were told the reservation was only for 4 nights. Really? We would not make a reservation for 4 nights and plan on being there for 7. After them giving us the run around for over 30 minutes on the phone and very RUDE and unhelpful people at the hotel we called the 800 # back and cancelled the whole reservation and booked a different hotel. There are a lot of choices for hotels these days and bad customer service is not acceptable in my book. Can't wait to spend time on the boardwalk!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Not very helpful, threw blame”
Reviews.Author: LindaNewHolland
Reviews.Content: My husband booked this hotel threw Orbitz (not a good idea) however he is not use to booking any of our travel plans. I was celebrating my 50th Birthday. He booked an ocean front room, which we did not get, they did move us to a side view, but I loved the fact that they said there were no ocean front rooms with a king bed, they just don't make those.....also I found this hotel to be so dirty, old, needing a much update..for the money that was spent I could of went somewhere else for a better room, the only plus was the restaurant on site. would never stay here again........

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Kendra W
Reviews.Content: My family and I went down In April for Our Wedding It was Wonder the Staff is Friendly and Hotel is Very Clean This is our 7th Year staying at the HOJO we just love it there Looking Forward to going back down in August!

Reviews.Title: “Ok...But Won't Be Back”
Reviews.Author: Jennie A
Reviews.Content: Overall we had a great time at this hotel but may be spoiled by other, newer hotels that we've stayed in in the past. The price was great however at $89 during off season. The room was clean but we stayed on the seventh floor and had a connecting room in which you could hear the person next door sneeze. The elevator was the scariest thing I have ever been on so we opted to use the stairs for our 3 day stay. The maid service was horrible! They didn't clean the room once and we were forced to call downstairs to the front desk 3 times to try and get new towels and trash pickup. Finally after the third time the little boy that worked upfront came up and took out the trash himself. The manager was very nice however and apologized for everything, eventually letting us stay a little later on the last day....unfortuantely she must have forgotten to tell the next upfront person because she called trying to evict us. It was a good stay but these minor problems will have us second guessing this hotel on the next trip to O.C.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice location & hotel”
Reviews.Author: Jack G
Reviews.Content: We stayed here Friday - Sunday in March. It was our first time at Ocean City. We were worried about the hotel for $74 a night. It turned out great! The room was clean, every one was friendly. Most of the time we stay at the Hampton Inn or higher class hotel. The view was great from our room. Brothers Bistro's brick oven pizza was fantastic! The service was very good & the same person waited on us the next morning at 7am. He must live there. Hojo did a good job fixing up the motel. The elevator was like riding a horse. It was bumpy but it added characte to the place. We would stay here again. We will ask for the same room. The bed was ok, but we are use to our beds at home. But we did sleep well. We really enjoyed this place.

Reviews.Title: “Great location close to everything you want in OCMD”
Reviews.Author: HDSoftailgirl89
Reviews.Content: They say its all about: Location, location location.. Well that holds true for this hotel!! We recently stayed for an overnight stay to enjoy the peace and quiet of the off-season. You can't beat the hotel being directly "on the boardwalk/ beach" and within walking distance to all the popular spots in OC!! The room was very spacious, clean and we had a great side-view of the ocean/ bay with an attached balcony for seating. The bed was "almost" as good as being in our own at home.. We had a very great stay at this hotel and eager to return again in the summer months when OCMD is at its peak for vactioning!

Reviews.Title: “great location.”
Reviews.Author: beach4meVirginia
Reviews.Content: Very clean room, we had ocean front deluxe, 7th floor. TV, picture was fuzzy on most channels, didn't have hd, so some stations were not available...but no big deal. Location was great, had Brass Balls next door for dinner, and has Brothers Bistro right in the building, so didn't have to drive much. the room was a lot larger than some rooms, had a nice seating area. The main thing we didn't like, and we heard a few people complain about was the elevators. They seemed to jump a lot and scared a lot of people when they stopped, it was like a big drop. Did not like them at all.

Reviews.Title: “Good for a weekend stay”
Reviews.Author: NeeR_RG
Reviews.Content: I stayed at howard and Johnson with my husband for a night on 9th Oct. It was over all a very satisfactory experience. Good Points: 1) Location !! Location !! Location : its located right at the beach. We didn't take a sea view room but it didn't matter as it took a minute to get to the beach. Also, its right in the middle of activity with many restaurants around. 2) Price: Not sure what the season rates are but we got a standard king for $60 as it was off-season. It wasn't a sea facing room, and the view we had was of the parking lot located behind the hotel. We spent the entire day on the beach so didn't matter to us. 3) Room: The room was very big,clean and bright, just how I like it. Lot's of sunshine and natural light and colorful decor. It also had all the basic amenities, microwwave, refrigerator, hair dryer, coffee machine, clothes iron. Much better than I have seen in some hotels with better rating. 4) Indoor swimming pool: It has an indoor swimming pool at the ground floor, looked very nice and clean though we didn't actually use it. 5) Enviornment Friendly: I really liked how they had taken steps to make everything enviornment friendly. Not sure how well all the practises are actually followed, but it did seem to be a nice effort on their part. 6) Friendly staff: I spoke to 3 people on the front desk, all of them were polite and friendly. The house keeping staff was also very co-operative. Not so good points: There was nothing bad 1) Bathroom: It was spotless, no problems there. However it really needed some sort of mats or something for absorbing the water on the floor. It got totally wet after I took a shower and was like that for most of the duration of the stay. I do not like using towels for cleaning the floor hence it remained messy throughout. 2) Lighting in the room was very poor: The room was a very good size but there were only 2 lamps, that too located at odd corners. It was poorly lit by the night and I wouldn't have enjoyed reading in that much light. 3) The pillows: The pillows were more like cushions and a little comfortable. Over I was 100% statisfied with the experience. The rates were good, it was clean and location was great. Wasn't expecting more.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice, Convenient Location”
Reviews.Author: kneppce07
Reviews.Content: We stayed here when we decided to grab an extra night at the beach. We like to eat at the italian place on the bottom-- so we thought we would check out the prices and see if we could stay here. We were here on a Sunday night in early October, we paid about 60 dollars for an ocean view room--- and we were right on the boardwalk... The room was so clean, they provided nice amenities, the shower was very spacious, and the bed was super comfy. French doors to the balcony were very cute. We loved it. Great experience.

Reviews.Title: “What i was looking for”
Reviews.Author: longisland_NYKleo
Reviews.Content: Nice and clean hotel on the boardwalk - golf trip for me and my dad, 2 seperate room. My first room had been smoked in and they quickly apologized and changed the room. Beds were not an issue, bathroom was clean, plenty of towels. Front desk should keep some sort of file system for pointing out where to go for dinner choices - i mean how many funnel cakes can 1 person eat. Check out was easy - the staff was friendly. Megan was terrific i would recomend

Reviews.Title: “very convienient location”
Reviews.Author: taraandbill
Reviews.Content: great location. good service. excellent restaurant attached with nice outdoor seating. recommend asking for an oceanfront room or a room on the north side of the hotel, otherwise, you get a view of the side of a restaurant and lots of loud air conditioners and a balcony that is extremely hot in the afternoon sun. parking is in an adjacent garage. didn't see any luggage carts to haul luggage up and down, but there are two elevators. nice porch for sitting in the shade.

Reviews.Title: “Family Fun at the Beach!”
Reviews.Author: mermaidCanandaiguaNY
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed a delightful stay at HJ Oceanfront Plaza with our Daughter, Son in Law and Granddaughter.. Our request for adjoining rooms was promptly taken care of so we could enjoy easy access to the family. The spacious side deck complete with big, comfy chairs is a perfect place to start the day; complimentary coffee with a beach view. HJ also hosts a lovely restaurant and lounge, Gusto's. Perfect spot for an easy and quick family breakfast by cheerful staff. They even were kind enough to put "Happy Anniversary Amanda & Mike" on their scrolling sign for all to see. Our kids loved it. In the evening when we had some adult time, it was just right for a nightcap. Ocean City is such a great vacation. The beach, the boardwalk, Trimper's Amusement Park.....memories are precious!

Reviews.Title: “SCAM ARTIST!!!”
Reviews.Author: WorldWideTraveler615
Reviews.Content: We recently booked a stay at this hotel. While reserving I specifically asked what the cancellation requirements were. I was told "you have 3 days to cancel, you must cancel by the 23rd to get your deposit back". Well mother nature is throwing us a hurricane this weekend so I called at 4:30 on the 23rd and was told "I'm sorry mam but you had to have called by 3pm to cancel I can not refund your deposit" When I told her that I was not made aware of that specification she immediately became very rude. I called corporate customer service and they tried calling the hotel and couldn't do anything. I was told to call the hotels general manager the next day....well its the next day I've called 5 times and got voicemail every time! Needless to say I will NEVER book here and hope nobody else has to go through this!

Reviews.Title: “Too much for too little”
Reviews.Author: starente
Reviews.Content: We just stayed here for a 4 day vacation in OC. I'll start with the good: just a few steps to the beach; couldn't be more convenient, located near several decent places to eat. Neutral: 2 mile walk to the midway where the games and rides are. We didn't mind because that's how we got our exercise in but someone older or with kids might find it too far to walk. Now the bad. The first night we were awaken by banging at the door with two men yelling "Police, open up!" Being from NY/NJ, I'm not trusting that it's really the police at my door in the middle of the night. When looked thru the peephole they were standing to the side and didn't show ID. As I went to call the front desk, my b/f opened the door with the latch on and saw that they were in uniform. One came in with a flashlight and looked out on our deck asking if we were out there. I said, "we were SLEEPING!" and he said "sorry, wrong room." After that my heart was racing and I couldn't fall back asleep very easily. Went to the front desk the next morning to ask what was going on and all they could say was there was someone yelling on a balcony. We asked what we should have done. They said the police have jurisdiction but you don't have to let anyone in. That was comforting. The next night the TV stopped working. A kid from the front desk came up and played around for 10 minutes finally fixing it. He said he's fixed about 40 in 4 months. Channels on the room listing aren't necessarily what you'll get. We had a about 10 channels and when I called about one in particular they said it might not be working because it was raining out. The room was average, bathroom door didn't close right, a hot water heater was badly disguised by a broken sliding curtain thing. And the "best room available" offer when I booked got us 2 double beds. Water pressure is really bad because they have water saving shower heads. Build in ten extra minutes for travel time while you wait for the elevators which are slow. The indoor pool and spa area could use some work but was sufficient when it rained out. For $260/night (including tax) I was hoping for a little better experience. Would not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “jenn was the best”
Reviews.Author: maddieisawesome
Reviews.Content: we stayed here in july and me and my two friends loved jenn the front desk worker. she was nice, and friendly. egor was also pretty cool. i would deffinetly go back again. i loved the location because my friends and i loved the rides on the boardwalk and it was a little walk but not fat at all. and my dad and his friend loved the brass balls place next door. GOO JENNNNNN!

Reviews.Title: “We loved it”
Reviews.Author: iris
Reviews.Content: The hotel is right on the boardwalk and beach. If yo want the amusement park, you have to use the tram. Restaurants are within walking distance. The hotel is clean, the hotel staff were helpful and friendly. The hotel recently got new beds and pillows which were very comfortable. I would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Hotel, i highly reccomend it!”
Reviews.Author: eclipsed00d
Reviews.Content: Howard Johnsons on 12th street was an awesome hotel, upon check in i was greeted by the friendly staff! I had booked a King Ocean view Room, and they upgraded my room to a King Ocean Front room for no apparent reason. The staff was so friendly and nice. I recommend this hotel to any one and i will be back in the near future and this was my first stay at any Howard Johnsons, and it really made my stay pleasurable. There were a few minor issues with my room, like the bed post was unattached from the bed and the stopper on the sink didn't work and i notified the front desk and these issues were corrected right away.

Reviews.Title: “Almost 5 stars”
Reviews.Author: SeaFist
Reviews.Content: Room was clean and comfortable. Check in and out went smoothly, and staff was friendly. The Serta mattress was obviously new, however there was no mattress pad under the fitted sheet. Since the mattress still looked so clean and new I only took away one star, but they really need to add mattress pads to protect the mattresses, and for sanitary reasons too. If a sheet gets wet, even just a spot, the moisture will go right into the mattress.

Reviews.Title: “suprisingly pretty nice”
Reviews.Author: Bola2084
Reviews.Content: I stayed here at the end of august for a 4 day stay with my boyfriend. I was pretty nervous after reaading some of the reviews but i just crossed my fingers and hoped for the best. When we arrived I didn't feel to much better, the lobby was nothing to look at and the indoor pool was extremely creepy looking ( which really didnt matter, I didn't come to ocean city to swim in a pool). What saved this place was the room, it was suprisingly spotless, The bathroom was very nice and clean and it had a nice balcony. It was also in a great location. overall it was a nice beach hotel.

Reviews.Title: “If They Would Just Get Rid of the Mold . . . .”
Reviews.Author: EnjoyTravelAlways
Reviews.Content: I had read the reviews. I didn't have a choice since this was where a conference I was attending was having our event. The reservation taker was very helpful and accommodating. Check in was fine. A few notes for you to consider. If you are disabled, be sure you have a parking permit since that will get you in on the ground floor of the garage. Otherwise, up you go and no elevator. Check in is on the first (ground is the street level) and there is only one space in the garage for people who are checking in. I took the chance and parked, registered, and brought my parking permit back out. The rooms are pretty much what you have read in other reviews. I regret that the restaurant next door (south) has their exhaust fan blasting so, unless you like the smell of food instead of sea breezes, it's not much fun sitting out on the balcony if they are cooking. The location is outstanding. It's just plain great to be there except . . . the mold. The room had obvious mold (black around the air conditioning vent . . . I chose to use a wash cloth to at least get rid of that (and it didn't take an ounce of elbow grease). As long as I was outside my room, I was fine . . . except for our meeting room on the ground floor. Again, just as in the room, my nose started and there was no stopping it. In the middle of our meeting, I walked down the street to get some allergy medicaiton since I could hardly stand being in the room with my eyes puffed up and nose going like Niagara. I informed the desk and I didn't seem to surprise them. I chose to leave early because I was not able to pay attention to anything besides my nose. I also know others had the bad mattress experience mentioned in other reviews since others in our group were complaining. Thankfully, mine was nice. The fridge and microwave in the room is a plus. The food served at an evening reception was delicious.

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly acceptable moderate beach hotel, terrific location, handicap rooms”
Reviews.Author: md_tide
Reviews.Content: This was my first stay in this hotel, it was a combination b-day/vacation/attend the big craft fair Sunfest held at Ocean City. I was traveling in this case with my parents, who after back surgeries earlier this year require baths fitted with handicap facilities (e.g., bars for tub, high toilets). Mostly I view hotels from the viewpoint of a solo traveler, so can't comment on the indoor pool (who needs a pool at the beach?) but it looked small/medium. Garage parking. Two slightly slow elevators with doors that are a bit vicious if they start to close, watch out you don't get hit. My room was a second floor sideview of the beach, which had a perfectly nice view, the metal awning described in an earlier post is there, but no cigarette butts, could be a problem if rain is pounding. I was happy enough with my room, evidently refurbished fairly recently, outfitted in pastel coastal colors with a king-size bed, lots of pillows, an a sofa where you could open the French door and get the side ocean view, or sit on the plastic balcony chairs. Small bathroom but quaint, pedestal sink with hair dryer - nice feature is the solar lamp, plenty of towels, soaps, etc. They offer to get you stuff you forget. One thing - the mattress seems to be some older springy type, didn't bother me much but my parents complained it was too soft and bothering to people with back issues. You kind of wallow in it, like the mattress is old (or cheap). Everything seemed to be quite clean, so I felt pretty badly when we discovered that the outdoor faucet quote "had been faulty so the handle was removed and it's been like that for 2 years". (Who runs a beach hotel and doesn't provide outside rinse facilities? It's going to cost more as guests dump more and more sand into your plumbing when they get to their rooms - geez.). Another slight annoyance was there was only ONE ice machine on the ground floor, I love my ice, hate it when hotels make you hike for an ice machine. But having the in-room fridge and microwave is a huge plus. I was crazy about the in-house restaurant, really delicious pizza, great drinks, excellent service, I'd stay here again just for the pizza - restaurant for sure gets 5 STARS! For my purposes since I just want a quiet, convenient, place to stay with a fridge and easy beach access, this was perfectly acceptable - if they had a ground-level bathroom I didn't see it, so if you come in from the sand you have to go to your room to use the bathroom, and thanks to the broken faucet sand gets everywhere *shrugs*. Overall, it's sort of like a Hampton Inn that needs a bit of work, but it's fine, especially if you don't spend a lot of time in your room anyway. We chose this over the Marriott, prices in this area are bloated anyway, but we are not spending $400+ a night for a hotel room in an upscale hotel. Fortunately we showed up just before a tour bus pulled up with around 50 people staying here. I would stay here with kids, the outdoor pool is gone, evidently made into a sitting area, I'd just be prepared to NOT spend daytime in the hotel, to keep an eye on the elevator doors, and head for the beach or boardwalk - if you are from out of town the boardwalk can be a LONG walk, take the tram or wear good shoes.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, good restaurant and very nice location”
Reviews.Author: kujoslice
Reviews.Content: 3rd time at this hotel with my wife, son 12 and his friend. The staff is friendly and on point. The rooms were clean and the staff did a very good job of cleaning up the sand in the room daily. We stay here for the location first, then the rooms and staff. It is also very convenient to have a full service restaurant in the hotel. The food is very good, the boys loved the brick oven pizzas. My only issue was later at night when my wife and I sit at the bar with friends. Every night a few younger gentlemen would play some crazy odd music and kept changing songs half way through. Very annoying when trying to have a conversation or watch one of the Tv's. Unprofessional... One of the staff mentions Fausto's kids or relatives running amuck at night in the bar area.... Other than that, I will book again next year.

Reviews.Title: “Another good year”
Reviews.Author: tesrick
Reviews.Content: Second time we have stayed here and the service was excellant again. Friendly staff. Requested third floor....got it. Left notes for housekeeping...extra towels...received it. One day she forgot to leave soap....Bathroom is a bit small...just need to utilize the small cabinet. Bring hanging toiletry bags. Location is excellant. Restaurant is great. Oversized vehicles have to park on the first floor of the parking ramp. One thing I think the staff should tell owners of regular cars to park on the upper levels.

Reviews.Title: “not bad!”
Reviews.Author: amliebsten
Reviews.Content: the rooms were nice and clean. cable tv with minibar. the indoor pool was a little dirty, especially the jacuzzi. but at that time of the year, we almost had the entire hotel to ourselves. i liked it!

Reviews.Title: “Would not stay here if it was free!”
Reviews.Author: bradynsmom
Reviews.Content: My family has been going to Ocean City for about ten years and we have never stayed in such a dirty, ill run, and just nasty place. Upon checking in we noticed that the brand new flat screen tv was broken. There was always sound but only picture once in awhile. Then as my husband shut the door a piece of molding fell off the wall because the patch it was round was so rotten. Everytime you shut the door it fell of with nails sticking out of it. There were hairs all over the bathtub when I ran a bath for my toddler. And gross foamy soap scum in the water. i had to rerun the water three times before it went away. When we decided to try out the indoor pool it was freezing cold and there were only dirty towels available. They had a sign asking you to shower before entering the pool but the shower had no hot water and the room was not heated. The so called hot tub was just as cold as the pool. The service did not help this hotel at all they didn't even look at you when you walked up to the front desk. After our room had not been swept after the first three days of our stay I asked housekeeping to if they could sweep the floor and was told they only sweep after check out not during your stay. My family with return to Ocean City but will not return to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Better Than Expected”
Reviews.Author: adidaseeyore
Reviews.Content: My husband's family organized a 70th Birthday Weekend for his Aunt. I looked up reviews on the hotel right before we left. I was extremely wary of the establishment the entire trip to Ocean City. The check in clerk was extremely nice and friendly. Our room was on the fourth floor and we had a partial ocean view from the balcony. The room wasn't anything extra fancy, but it was exactly what we needed; clean bed, clean bath, and a tv. Yes there is a cleaner aroma when you enter the hallways. It was gone apon entering our room. The mini frig & freezer were clean as was the microwave. I've always been nervous about elevators, so I did use the stairs the entire stay. However, the elevators seemed a bit on the slow side but no one seemed to mind. The meeting room was nice and big for the amount of people we had gathered. It had bathrooms and a kichenette which was very useful since everyone brought snacks and drinks. The hotel also provided us with fresh coffee every morning and we had no problem getting refills. I didn't care for the lack of windows in the meeting room(it's on the ground floor, so low ceilings, lots of flourescent light) so I didn't spend alot in there. I thouroughly enjoyed the Boardwalk right out the door. Hotel is located pretty much in the middle of the Boardwalk. The kids loved being right on the beach during the day, and the pool at night. My husband and I went to next door for dinner and our meal was good. Of course there is ample candy stores, and caramel corn and all the wonderful things to eat on the boardwalk. For the price, it was great. Not the seedy shore dive I expected. Actually planning a friends bachlorette party weekend in Ocean City and considering staying at the Howard Johnson plaza!

Reviews.Title: “Do not recommend -- Unless you like living in a box!!!”
Reviews.Author: grimmcs
Reviews.Content: KEEP LOOKING DON'T STAY HERE OR ANY OF THE OTHER HOJO PROPERTIES!!!! Very dissappointed in this hotel -- they really need to update everything -- no outdoor pool. Indoor pool was dirty!!!! Room was way to small -- we had a king size bed and sleep sofa for our daughter age 4 and when we opened the sofa you could not even get to the balcony. Room was entirely tooooooo small and the service was not the best at all. Yes we could have upgraded to a bigger room for an additional 100.00 per night -- did not feel this place was worth that. Manager was not willing to work something out for us. I tried to find another place -- but was hard to move all of our stuff again. Find many better rates!!!! KEEP LOOKING DON'T STAY HERE!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, but the outdoor pool is gone”
Reviews.Author: Ben7476
Reviews.Content: We've stayed at the Hoard Johnson Plaza Oceanfront several times, most recently Aug. 6-9. The room was clean and so was the hotel. It's a great location and the in-house restaurant on the first level, Fausto's had the best brick-oven pizza I've tasted. My only dissappointment was that the advertised "Outdoor" pool has been completely filled in and turned into an outdoor dining area! My young grandson really enjoyed that pool the last time we were there. The indoor pool is in the lower level and was satisfactory. All in all, we'd probably stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid Howard Johnson Plaza Hotel -Ocean city Oceanfront”
Reviews.Author: pafhmc
Reviews.Content: I was very dissapointed in ths hotel. The web site showed a beautiful outdoor pool along the boardwalk which excited my children. Uopn my arrival no outdoor pool only to find the dirtiest indoor pool I have ever seen with a cool dirty water jacuzzi. The first 2 days the shower worked but the 3rd some plumbing problem . No running water for most of the day and minimal water pressure to wash off after a long day with the kids on the beach. I paid $320.00 a night for 3 nights and they could not even have updated plumbing. I paid extra for ocean view but the small print on the reservation said "sideview" The entire hotel faces toward the ocean or side. I felt like I payed extra for nothing. I felt cheated from a dishonest hotel and would never return.

Reviews.Title: “Wouldn't Stay Again”
Reviews.Author: oceangal914
Reviews.Content: We reserved an oceanfront room for three nights. We arrived to find out we were on the second floor with a balcony that was right over an awning. If you sat in the chair, you could not see the ocean, just the awning which was covered in bird poop, trash and cigarette butts. The hotel is non-smoking, but for some reason they allow guests to smoke on the balcony. As I was standing there, someone in one of the rooms above us dropped a cigarette butt and it landing on the awning right in front of me. I spoke with the front desk and was told that there were no other oceanfront rooms available. We eventually settled for a street side room with an ocean view.

Reviews.Title: “DO NOT STAY HERE--LIARS LIARS LIARS!!!!”
Reviews.Author: funtraveller01
Reviews.Content: First, after viewing the property online, we called the 800 reservations number to make a reservation. They booked us for the inn and not the plaza. When we tried to get it corrected, the staff at the plaza, namely front desk agents, Jamal and Malsma, were terribly rude. To add insult to injury, Jamal LAUGHED in my face about the mix up. They were unapologetic, uncooperative and lied about resolving the situation. Staying oceanfront here is not worth it!! To give customer service a rating of 0 would only be a compliment. Spend your money elsewhere, DON'T STAY HERE!!!!!!!.

Reviews.Title: “Average Hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: hawkmp
Reviews.Content: It's your average hotel room. It's not the Hilton but It was clean and quite so no complaints. Good amount of parking too. I would stay there again. One thing, what is up with that tiny pool in front of the restaurant??? Can you even swim in that???...Do they even still advertise an outdoor pool because they did when I stayed there... Hope this helps

Reviews.Title: “It was nasty”
Reviews.Author: Katie009
Reviews.Content: The room was about what we expected in terms of size, but it really was not clean. The bathroom was rather dirty. The carpets throughout the hotel were stained and dirty. My big complaint was that the pool was filthy. There was so much sand at the bottom of the pool and jacuzzi that you may have thought you were in the ocean. Since we were there in October, it's not likely that the sand was drug into the pool recently and therefore must never get cleaned. The water was so dirty that you could not see through it. Yuck. Service was decent and the ocean front bar was cool. The web-site said that the hotel was recently rennovated, but that's pretty hard to believe. Maybe new bedspeads is considered a rennovation?

Reviews.Title: “Barely Adequate in OC MD”
Reviews.Author: MartyGirl
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this hotel for one night over Labor Day weekend. We picked this hotel strictly for the access to the boardwalk and it did fit that bill. Literally on the boardwalk near 11th street, it was a longish walk to the main rides/arcade area but we had no problem doing the round trip walking. For those who prefer the ride, there is a tram to ride the boardwalk. Be aware that this area is still noisy – a band was playing long into the night in the bar next to the hotel. The pool was miniscule and did not look clean but the beach is literally out the front door. The hotel room was barely acceptable and far from clean. The bathroom was small and old and dirty. It was adequate for one night – I would not have wanted to stay longer than that. The one bright spot was the hotel restaurant – a brick oven pizza place – that had excellent food and service for dinner. We were only there for one night over the holiday weekend but my advice would be to look elsewhere (particularly given the prices) for lodging in OCMD.

Reviews.Title: “VERY DISSAPOINTED!!”
Reviews.Author: motleysgirl
Reviews.Content: After the last 2 years of splurging on vacations to Sea World in 06 and Disney ( with ALLL the extras) in 07 money was a HUGE issue for us this year. We had decided to take our girls ( 6 and 13) for a long weekend before school started. I'll be honest, the last 2 vacations we stayed first class hotels and knew going in anything less would be somewhat of a disapointment, but I did a TON of research too get the best deal. to read reviews, etc. I choose this hotel (1) it was directly on the boardwalk, had an indoor and outdoor pool and seemed by reviews I read to be a clean hotel. I went through directly calling the hotel and recieved one rate $249 a nite, ocreservations.com and got a rate of $269 a nite and the howard johnson website. I made the reservation via the phone with howard johnson website phone number. I had a VERY NICE conversation with the lady who gave me a discounted rate ( guess I was just super nice and she was having a good day) of $199 a nite. I thought this is great!! I purchased 2 wrist bands for my girls to get into Jolly Rogers at a discounted rate and saved $4 each so I was excited to get going. Thursday- arrive @ 7:30- check in @ front desk and am given my room keys. I asked for my wrist bands for the girls to use them the next day ( THEY ARE ONLY GOOD FROM 1-5). I was told the manager wasn't there, and to get them I had to see her and she would be in Friday morning. Checked into the room, unpacked and although the room was SMALL and the bathroom was A CLOSET(you couldn't fit 2 people in there at all) it was CLEAN! The girls grabbed their suits and we headed to the pool to relax from our 3 our drive. Inside pool was FILTHY - GREEN and you couldnt' see the bottom. We went to the outside pool, which was MAYBE 1/10% better. We go back to the room change to hit the boardwalk- our AC doesn't work. They send up a maintenace guy and he fixes it within minutes- I ask him about the pool and he says-- the health dept was just here 2 days ago- it is safe to get into, it just looks really bad!! ARE YOU KIDDING ME?? Friday morning- hit the front desk on our way to the beach- manager is still MIA ( bank/errands, etc) and nobody could help with my wrist bands. Went back to our room and our TV didn't work. No maintenenace person around to help- it took my husband unplugging it from the wall and resetting it to work. Saturday morning- manager is on duty- but she didn't have bands for me, she said to come back in a few hours and they woudl be there. It is already Saturday when I bought them to use on Friday ( we had plans on Saturday with our church group that came down for the day). The whole experience was unpleasant- from the dirty pools, to wasting $27 on wristbands I didn't get to use to finding an emply wine bottle under my bed ( which obviously wasn't as clean as I thought it was). The manager did give me 1 night free stay--- but to me it wasn't nearly enough for the trouble and horrible service I recieved. The ONLY good thing about this was the location.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay!”
Reviews.Author: jld1031
Reviews.Content: We just got back from a weeks stay at the HOJO Oceanfront Plaza. Let me tell you number one this was our first time in Ocean City and I have a 3 year old boy. I was veryimpressed. This is the best vacation place I have ever been too! the hotel room is smaller than I am used to but honestly it did not matter because we really only slept there. The staff was pleasant, elevators worked fine, room and facility was clean. Food was good, This place is great for the money! I have no complaints and I complain about everything! OC is great for kids lots and I mean lots to do!!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location at 11st St., bright restaurant/lounge and pool on boardwalk,”
Reviews.Author: EllKell
Reviews.Content: Parking was fine, first room had a bad plumbing smell, so switched with no problem. It's a very old building, which is nice in one way because the walls are thick with sound insulation. Only concern was the elevator had broken down in the heat a few days before, so we used the stairs most of the time. Housekeeping was great. The room was tiny, but that was okay because we spent little time there. The indoor pool in the basement was too dark, but good if it's raining (or snowing in winter!) No free breakfast, but plenty of great, cheap food within two blocks in both directions on the boardwalk. Also fantastic Phillips buffet for a good price close by. Beach is wonderful with lots of activities, always action to watch. Boardwalk has a tram if you don't want to walk.

Reviews.Title: “Bad Experience!”
Reviews.Author: AnnMaryland
Reviews.Content: My family (2 adults and 2 children) decided to go to Ocean City with my parents. We made our reservations for 2 rooms that would be near each other about 2 weeks before our vacation time. When we arrived the first thing we noticed that there was no place to park in order to check in and take in our luggage. The second thing we noticed was the moldy smell when we walked into the hotel. We got to the front desk and found out that our rooms were on 2 different floors which did not make us very happy. We were told that that was all that was available. We took our luggage up to our rooms via the elevator. I think the elevator is the slowest one I have ever been on and it is also unsafe. I had my finger on the door open button so that my 6 year old could get out with his luggage. The elevator door came shut with him not completely out the door. Our room was on the 5th floor facing the Brass Balls Saloon. The room was very small. The walls were dirty and the AC was very noisy. The view, which was suppose to be of the ocean, was of the AC unit of the Brass Balls Saloon (which was also very noisy). After we got our luggage into our room, we decided to go down and check out the indoor pool. That was gross! Apparently the skimmer was not working because there was stuff floating on the top and the water was very cloudy. That was it....we decided to get our money back and go to another hotel. We went to the Stowaway Grand Hotel and was VERY PLEASED!

Reviews.Title: “watch your bill”
Reviews.Author: trvlr12345
Reviews.Content: We made reservations at this hotel, then we read the horrible reviews of it so we cancelled our reservations by phone. They refunded our credit card. Then a few days later they charged our credit card again and a few days later they charged it again!! A total of about $200 was charged to our card (besides the original charge) and not refunded. We are disputing the charges now.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely filthy and gross!!!”
Reviews.Author: travelerchase00
Reviews.Content: Where do I start??? We checked in alright, and went to our room to find out just how much of a pig-sty we were staying in. Horrible! The bathroom was gross: Mold on the ceiling, stained towels, dirty floor, a "rubber" around the shower head (see photo)!?! The room was small, smelly (mostly due to the restaurant across the way), and extremely run down considering the hotel claimed to be renovated. The ceilings were very low, the beds had a dip in the middle, the curtains over the balcony slider had stains on them, the coat closet had a huge water heater taking up all the space, and the AC vents were moldy as well. Speaking of our "view" - it was of the adjacent hotel and restaurant across the way, complete with dumpster smell. The slider barely moved it was so old and falling apart. After seeing all this, we tried to move to a better room, but was told the entire hotel was sold out! I did visit our friends in an oceanfront room... still a bit run down, with stained carpets, but no moldly bathroom. On the plus side, the restaurant was great. Breakfast was yummy and the waitstaff is fabulous. The bartender was very nice. Don't ever stay here! Its great to be on the boardwalk, yes, but stay somewhere nice and just drive down to the boardwalk and pay parking, or take the bus! Its quite a walk to go all the way down to the amusements.

Reviews.Title: “Downright disgusting!!”
Reviews.Author: 4everabeachbum
Reviews.Content: This was the most disgusting place we have ever stayed in. There was a bad odor throughout the hotel. The room was very warm when we arrived. The bathtub had hair in it, the shower curtain had mold on it, and the shower floor looked like it hadn't been cleaned in a long time. You could write your name on the dust on the glass shelves in the bathroom. The table in the bedroom section looked as if the leg were about to come off and the one chair was in bad need of re-upholstering. The small refrigerator had to be cleaned before we put our food in it and when we woke up in the morning, everything we had put in it was frozen. The indoor pool and jacuzzi were gross.....green and murky. The ceiling above the pool looks nothing like the picture on the website. Instead, it had peeling light and dark blue paint on it, with water dripping from it. When we checked out, the receptionist, whose nametag indicated she was from the Days Inn, had a scowl on her face and never even looked up at us.....and we hadn't even given her our complaints. We wouldn't wish a stay in this hotel on our worst enemy.

Reviews.Title: “Great boardwalk location”
Reviews.Author: bahamamamaa
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Howard Johnson's, boardwalk at 12th Street, several times. It's my favorite hotel in Ocean City. Prime location, parking garage, restaurant/bar, indoor and outdoor pools, balconies, bike rentals, nice lobby, microwave/refrig/coffee maker...what more can you ask for in a beach hotel room? I have enjoyed all my stays there.

Reviews.Title: “Dirty”
Reviews.Author: Grumpynomore
Reviews.Content: An older hotel that has been remodeled. Older is ok, but there is no excuse for dirty. Tub needed scrubbing, floor needed vacuuming, phone needed cleaning, and underside of comfortable was dirty and stained. Both indoor and outdoor pools looked murky and dirty - I wouldn't want to get in. Good points were large windows and good views from our upper floor room and a comfortable king bed.

Reviews.Title: “Great Boardwalk Location”
Reviews.Author: TravelingMom48
Reviews.Content: We booked this trip at the 12th St Howard Johnson's through Ocean City Maryland hotel site - this was a budget trip for us, but we wanted to stay on the boardwalk. (rm was approx $180/night, not including taxes, not bad for peak season) This was a good location on the boardwalk, head south and you are right at the shops and attractions. We took tram ride up and down boardwalk and the further north you head, the more it was just hotels and houses and less of the shops. I was happy w/ this hotel. Yes, the elevators were slow when we checked in but that is to be expected w/ the heavy usage they were receiving. Once everyone was settled, the wait was never that bad. Parking garage at rear provided adequate parking. It is confusing if you come in across from garage at indoor pool level cuz check in is one floor up. Better signage about this by the hotel would help. The hotel has a U-shaped configuration and the even number rooms ( on the south side) are definitely less desirable, overlooking the Brass Balls Saloon. The higher floors are better because you are above the neighboring building. We were on 3rd flr and AC units and their noise line the alley between you and Brass Balls. However, we were first room around the corner which still gave us a small but nice ocean front view. There was never a "partying" noise problem from next door while we were there, but, it was a Sunday and Monday night, so probably was calmer than a Fri or Sat night. Room was small, but I wasn't really planning on hanging out in there anyway. Our room was clean w/ 4 pillows on each bed and lots of shelves in the bathroom. Hotel employees were all very nice and the issue mentioned by another poster regarding the safe was clearly explained at check-in (although I might have just gotten lucky w/ my clerk, so be sure to ask.) Indoor pool was rather murky looking when we arrived, but we had good weather, and mgmt did recognize problem and close and drain pool on the second day of our stay ( a Monday). Outdoor pool is small, but interesting w/ water features and bridge crossing over it. Good for kids at the end of the day or to sit overlooking the boardwalk. Again, be advised, this area is small, w/ approx. 4 umbrella tables and two lounges on each side of the bridge. There was an outdoor shower near the boardwalk pool which came in very handy for a final cleanup after we had checked out but stayed the day on the beach. Bicycle rental place was located in basement of hotel, very handy and run by very nice people. I thought restaurant was expensive ( $9) breakfasts, but we did have a pizza late one night, (it was available until midnight) and it was very good. Overall I think this hotel provides an average clean room w/ a great boardwalk location. We would have no problem staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Not a bad stay, not a good one either.”
Reviews.Author: AltoonaMomto2
Reviews.Content: Well, to start off, there is a nice parking garage right behind the hotel. This was nice at the time we stayed... we always got a ground level parking spot. The hotel lobby was nice, and check in was quick. The decor in the lobby was quite nice and comfortable. The elevator and hallways were nice as well. The room was sort of small (2 adults, 2 children under 3 years old). But how often do you really sit around your room for any length of time? The pool had a strong chlorine smell and was not heated as the website said (so I thought anyway). It took forever to get the room cleaned, and even then, it wasn't exactly tip top shape. On our second day, my 3 year old son found an aspirin pill under the TV stand. Thankfully, he showed it to us before doing other things with it (such as putting it in his mouth). That was a real turn off, that could of been a life or death situation. BTW, I also found a love note between the headboard and the night stand the same day. In other words, I think they need to be a little more thorough in cleaning. BTW, the bathroom is WAY TOO TINY! I couldn't even have the door open when I bathed my kids, there's just not enough room. My knees touched the door if I sat on the toliet with the door open. Check out is another story... they neglect to tell you about the safe fee. (except in the tiny, tiny print that is at the check in desk and on the safe itself.) Upon check out, we said we didn't use the safe, so we aren't going to pay for it. (this is an option, you know). Well, instead of the girl removing it, she added it into our charges, totaling an extra $4.50 (safe is 1.50 + tax/day). So, then she figured out how to remove it, then she was going to charge us the full hotel stay amount (including the 1 night deposit we already made). So, after being on the phone w/her manager and 20 minutes later... we finally got the right amount. All in all, for only $139/night in mid/late June... I guess the stay wasn't too bad.. except for the cleanliness issue. Oh, and btw... if you use the telephone, it's 60 cents each time you call out... be it long distance or local (just beware)

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for our trip”
Reviews.Author: LttlRed
Reviews.Content: The hotel was great. We had a corner room, which was great because of the extra light. The location is excellent, right in the middle of the boardwalk, and the hotel was clean, the staff pleasant, and the restaurant's breakfast buffet was good (unfortunately, it's not the hotel's restaurant, so you have to pay for breakfast). Got a rate under 200 bucks, which is hard to do for such a good location on the 4th of July. We were highly satisfied.

Reviews.Title: “Last time.....”
Reviews.Author: overspent
Reviews.Content: HJ has gone down...I spent 289.00 a night to stay in a hotel who's features are not worth the money. the hotel is not as clean as it was in 2004. The carpet was dirty the bathrooms were not that clean and they even asked if we would use the towels more then once, the bathroom door knob was hanging off and the only cleaning done in my 5 day stay was the making of the beds. in 2004 i feel in love with their jacuzzi but this time it was occupied by kids with their dirty shoes on... But as they say you live and you learn i will never stay again...

Reviews.Title: “Never Again”
Reviews.Author: micbar68
Reviews.Content: Our stay at this hotel was absolutley terrible. The room was dirty, the hot water tank was leaking onto the floor-we had wet carpet. The clothes hanging rack was coming out of the wall and could not tell if the room was ever vacuumed. This hotel did not have several of the amenities listed on Hotel. The indoor pool was too cold to swim in and there were no towels, just the dirty towel bin loaded with towels since our first night's stay. The breakfast buffet was awful. All of us left angry and after paying $9.00 a person. They let skateboarders roam the parking garage. We had complained about all of this to the Hotel Manager and all she could do was repeat "really, I didn't know that". I congratulate those who did have a good stay at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “We Had A Great Time!”
Reviews.Author: Terann
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just got back from a week down at the ocean and we had a wonderful time. A big part of that was because of the Howard Johnson Hotel. I'm not quite sure why other people had horrible experiences, but our experience was wonderful. Our room was clean and nicer than some of the other higher priced hotels that we have stayed at. The price was decent and you couldn't beat the location. The indoor pool was a definite plus and all the people at the front desk were friendly and helpful. I feel bad for all those who won't stay there again but my husband and I definitely will. We're already planning for next year. Thanks Howard Johnson for a great vacation and see you next year Fall Cruisers!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “hotel was great”
Reviews.Author: PennyslvaniaSlushie
Reviews.Content: This was mine and my husband's trip to the ocean in 20 years. I booked the hotel on line and was not sure what it would be like. I viewed the pictures on line and was very impressed. My daughter goes to ocean city every year but stay at a different hotel. My granddaughter saw Howard Johnsons, ocean front and she was happy that we was going to stay there. Well we arrived in Ocean City and proceeded to the hotel. We arrived then went to our room. We were both very happy. It was a spacious room for us. We had a nice balcony and a wonderful view of the boardwalk and most of all the beach. The staff was very courteus and helpful to us. We had a wonderful week there. We will most defitnely return to Howard Johnson Ocean Front the next time. It was a fair price and the room was very nice.

Reviews.Title: “Will never stay there again”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I had a terrible experience at this hotel. Th room was dirty, service was terrible. We had no tissues, asked housekeeping & she said we'd get them, it took 2 days for a box to arrive. We ran out of toilet paper & had to get our own, not enough towels for 3 guests in the small room they gave us. By the way we requested an ocean front room & didn't get it, then when we asked about it, it was like "we'll get back to you." Guess what?? We never got any answer. I can tell you we will NEVER stay there again. Linda in Pa.

Reviews.Title: “H.J. Plaza Really Overrated”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We were very disappointed in our hotel. We traveled with a senior group and requested an room oceanfront. We got a room facing the side street. That wasn't disappointing enough but then the room was small for 3 people and the maid service was really bad. When we got there we had no tissues, not enough towels, our bathroom was dirty, there were pumpkin seeds on the floor (and they were still there when we left 5 days later.) We had to get toilet paper ourselves. A breakfast buffet was included with our trip. The restaurant was DIRTY. The ceilings had mold on, the vents were filthy with black soot. The food was greasy. We ate cereal and fruit to stay away from the grease. I really like the beach but I would NEVER stay at this hotel again and I would not recommend it. Lou - Pa.

HotelInfo.Name: Howard Johnson Oceanfront Plaza Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: 1109 Atlantic Avenue, Ocean City, MD 21842
